verses.verse: {For the Director: On the Gittith. By Asaph.} {Celebrating and Remembering God} d Sing joyfully to God, our strength. Raise a shout to the God of Jacob.
Sing a song and play the tambourine, the pleasant-sounding lyre along with the harp.
Blow the ram's horn when there is a New Moon, when there is a full moon, on our festival day,
because it is a statute in Israel, an ordinance by the God of Jacob,
a decree that he prescribed for Joseph when he went throughout the land of Egypt, speaking a language I did not recognize. {Lit. hear}
I removed the burden from your {Lit. his} shoulder; your {Lit. his} hands were freed of the burdensome basket. {Lit. hands let pass through the basket}
In a time of need you called out and I delivered you; I answered you from the dark thundercloud; I tested you at the waters of Meribah. (Interlude)
Listen, My people and I will warn you. Israel, if only you would obey me!
You must neither have a foreign god over you or worship a strange god.
I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, open your mouth that I may fill it.
Yet my people didn't obey my voice; Israel didn't submit to me.
So I allowed them {Or it / her} to continue in their stubbornness, living by their own advice.
If only my people would obey me, if only Israel would walk in my ways!
Then I would quickly subdue their enemies. I would turn against their foes.
Those who hate the Lord will cringe before him; their punishment will be permanent.
But I will feed Israel {Lit. him} with the finest wheat, satisfying you with honey from the rock.
